thread.title: Hockey Players Scuffle, Serve Penalties, Leave Box, Immediately Fight For Real
thread.title_full: Hockey Players Scuffle, Serve Penalties, Leave Box, Immediately Fight For Real

author: Samer Kalaf
title: Hockey Players Scuffle, Serve Penalties, Leave Box, Immediately Fight For Real
text:
Go to permalink 
Kings winger Jarome Iginla and Oilers forward Patrick Maroon finished the first period of Monday’s game with matching minor penalties for roughing, after the two got into a shoving match near the Los Angeles goal. Iginla and Maroon were able to stew over the course of a full intermission, so when they left their respective boxes in the beginning of the second, they quickly dropped gloves. Advertisement 
The players showed such efficiency in their release from the box to the actual fight: 
This time, Iginla and Maroon each earned five for fighting. They didn’t accrue any further penalties after that as the Oilers won, 2-0. Recommended Stories
